result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence H. O'Bannon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terrence H. O'Bannon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Terrence H. O'Bannon was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, On or Near a School], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.  Psychiatric/psychological,  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with Demetrius Taylor, or Kyle Mierzejawski, unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Pay Supervision fees as ordered by DOC.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments are made.  DE is sentenced to 7 years in the WSP forthwith; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years Extended Supervision.  Credit for 477 days.   DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Cash Bond on deposit between 14CF234 & 14CF235is to be applied.  No contact with Demetrius T. or Keyl M. unless permitted by the Court.   Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 9/11/15 at 10:30 AM.

14CF234/14CF235

Hearing canceled and conveyance notified DE won't be needed in court today.  FPT rescheduled to 6/4/15 at 8:30 AM and Atty Caspari to provide notice to defendant.
